means: 节日假期（从 12 月到 1 月上旬，包括圣诞节、修殿节和新年）

sentence.Network_en: She spends her Easter holidays taking groups of children to France.
sentence.Network_cn: 她带领一群孩子去法国过复活节。

sentence.Network_en: They had children and were consequently tied to the school holidays.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们有孩子，当然就受学校假期的束缚。

sentence.Network_en: Family holidays are meant to be a break from routine.
sentence.Network_cn: 家庭假日就是从平淡的日常生活中解脱一下。

entry.def: A holiday is a period of time during which you relax and enjoy yourself away from home. People sometimes refer to their holiday as their holidays.

example.ex: I've just come back from a holiday in the United States...
We rang Duncan to ask where he was going on holiday...
example.tran: 我们打电话给邓肯，问他要去哪里度假。

entry.def: A holiday is a day when people do not go to work or school because of a religious or national festival.

example.ex: New Year's Day is a public holiday throughout Britain...
example.tran: 元旦是全英国的公众假日。

example.ex: He invited her to spend the Fourth of July holiday at his summer home on Fire Island...
example.tran: 他邀请她去自己在法尔岛上的消夏寓所过美国独立纪念日。

entry.def: The holidays are the time when children do not have to go to school.

example.ex: ...the first day of the school holidays.

entry.def: If you have a particular number of days' or weeks' holiday, you do not have to go to work for that number of days or weeks.

example.ex: Every worker will be entitled to four weeks' paid holiday a year.
example.tran: 每位工人每年都能享受4周的带薪休假。

entry.def: If you are holidaying in a place away from home, you are on holiday there.

example.ex: Sampling the local cuisine is one of the delights of holidaying abroad...
example.tran: 品尝当地菜肴是海外度假的乐趣之一。

example.ex: Vacant rooms on the campus were being used by holidaying families.
example.tran: 校园里的闲置宿舍住着一些度假的家庭。
